entry.dcterms:description: stereotypes regarding public safety; law-consciousness; opinions about the causes and prevalence of violence in the family (women and children battering, rape); evaluation of possible interfering in the violent actions of the family; personal experience of violence in the family; evaluation of the regulation punishing rape in marriage; opinions about the help accessible to the victims of violence, opportunities to reduce violence; knowledge about sexual violence, sexual harrassment made by men to children; evaluation of the possible institutional measures

A two-stage proportionately stratified probability sample of women over 18 years. At the first stage settlements were randomly selected from 9 settlements strata, at the second stage the responding women were selected using simple random sampling within the given settlement. The name of sepcific persons were taken from the data of the Central Registration and Electorial Bureau. The addresses that dropped out of the sample were replaced by supplementary addresses.
